item.title: Statistics for Machine Learning
item.author: Author
item.description: Data types in stats Examples of Numerical # continous mu = 20 sigma=2 data_continous = numpy.random.normal(mu, sigma, 1000) # generate from 100 to 150 with 0.1 difference sns.distplot(data_continous, color="blue") plt.show() # discrete import numpy as np dice_rolls = [np.random.randint(1, 7) for _ in range(10)] plt.hist(dice_rolls) plt.show() Nominal Data Data you can’t order. Gender religion hair color data = {'Name': ['Jim','Jake','Jessy'], 'Gender': ['Male','Male','Female'] } data = pd.DataFrame(data, columns=['Name', 'Gender']) data .
